message: Hi Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180. Is this something you'd be interested in?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?
I understand you're looking to get a good deal, Bob, but I was thinking more along the lines of $160. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this sale. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $140. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?
I'm still not willing to go that low, Bob. I can see you're serious about the product, so I'll meet you halfway again. I'll sell it to you for $155. That's the lowest I'm willing to go.
I really like the product, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $145?

I'm getting a bit frustrated, Bob. I've already met you halfway twice, and I'm starting to think you're not serious about buying the product. I'll make one more offer: $152. That's as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not interested, I'll have to sell it to someone else.
